P.title: Will the Republican nominee for President in 2024 win the general election?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the Republican nominee for President, as determined by the Republican National Convention and confirmed by major news organizations, wins the general election held on November 5, 2024. The outcome must be certified by the relevant election authorities and reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If the nominee is declared the winner by the Electoral College but later disqualified or if the election results are contested and not resolved by December 31, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

metadata.source_question: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on the Republican nominee winning the 2024 election, will a Trump family member be the nominee?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Republican nominee for President in 2024 wins the general election. This means that the Republican nominee, as determined by the Republican National Convention and confirmed by major news organizations, wins the general election held on November 5, 2024. The outcome must be certified by the relevant election authorities and reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If the nominee is declared the winner by the Electoral College but later disqualified or if the election results are contested and not resolved by December 31, 2024, this condition is not considered met.

Then, is the following true: A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024? This would resolve as Yes if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024, and (b) The Republican nominee wins the general election in 2024?
P_and_Q.body: This question resolves as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) A member of the Trump family, specifically Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump, is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024, as determined by the Republican National Convention and confirmed by major news organizations. (2) The Republican nominee wins the general election held on November 5, 2024, with the outcome certified by the relevant election authorities and reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If the nominee is declared the winner by the Electoral College but later disqualified or if the election results are contested and not resolved by December 31, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

P.title: Will Donald Trump run for President again in 2024?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if Donald Trump officially announces his candidacy for the 2024 Presidential election by December 31, 2024. An official announcement must be made through a recognized platform, such as a press conference, a campaign launch event, or a verified social media account. Any ambiguous statements about potential candidacy will not count; there must be a clear declaration of intent to run. The question resolves as No if he does not make such an announcement by the specified date, regardless of speculation or unofficial statements.

(b) One of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump. The question resolves as No if either Donald Trump does not make such an announcement by the specified date or none of the listed individuals is the Republican nominee.

P.title: Will a member of the Trump family hold a significant political office by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, any member of the Trump family (defined as Donald Trump, Melania Trump, Ivanka Trump, Eric Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Tiffany Trump, and Barron Trump) is elected or appointed to a significant political office in the United States. A 'significant political office' includes, but is not limited to, the following positions: President, Vice President, Senator, Representative, Governor, or any appointed position with substantial influence or authority at the federal or state level. The resolution will be based on official election results, government announcements, or credible reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). Temporary or ceremonial positions do not count towards this question's resolution.

P.title: Will Tucker Carlson secure the endorsement of a former President before the primaries?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before March 1, 2024, Tucker Carlson receives a public endorsement from a former President of the United States for his candidacy in the 2024 primaries. The endorsement must be made through a verified public statement, social media post, or official press release from the former President or their representatives. The endorsement must be clear and unequivocal, indicating support for Tucker Carlson's candidacy. Any informal statements or ambiguous comments will not count toward this resolution.

metadata.source_question: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Q_given_P.title: Given Tucker Carlson secures the endorsement of a former President before the primaries, will he be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before March 1, 2024, Tucker Carlson receives a public endorsement from a former President of the United States for his candidacy in the 2024 primaries. The endorsement must be made through a verified public statement, social media post, or official press release from the former President or their representatives. The endorsement must be clear and unequivocal, indicating support for Tucker Carlson's candidacy. Any informal statements or ambiguous comments will not count toward this resolution.

Then, is it true that Tucker Carlson will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as Yes if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as No. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. The resolution is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

The endorsement must be made through a verified public statement, social media post, or official press release from the former President or their representatives, and must be clear and unequivocal, indicating support for Tucker Carlson's candidacy. (b) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

metadata.source_question: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Q_given_P.title: Given Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will a major Republican candidate drop out of the race before the primaries in 2024?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means he is the candidate chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is listed as the candidate on the day of the 2024 US election.

Given this scenario, will a major Republican candidate drop out of the race before January 1, 2024? A 'major Republican candidate' is defined as any candidate who has consistently polled at 5% or higher in national polls conducted by reputable organizations (e.g., Gallup, Quinnipiac, Ipsos) leading up to the primaries. The candidate must officially announce their withdrawal through a public statement or press release, reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., CNN, BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post). A suspension of the campaign without a formal withdrawal announcement will also count as a drop out.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) a major Republican candidate drops out of the race before the primaries in 2024?
P_and_Q.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the election.

(b) Before January 1, 2024, any major Republican candidate officially announces their withdrawal from the race for the Republican nomination for President of the United States. A 'major Republican candidate' is defined as any candidate who has consistently polled at 5% or higher in national polls conducted by reputable organizations (e.g., Gallup, Quinnipiac, Ipsos) leading up to the primaries. The announcement must be made through a public statement or press release and reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., CNN, BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If a candidate suspends their campaign without a formal withdrawal announcement, this will also count as a drop out.

If both conditions are not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

P.title: Will Tucker Carlson's campaign raise over $10 million by the end of 2023?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2023, Tucker Carlson's campaign has officially reported raising over $10 million in total contributions. The total must be confirmed through a public disclosure report filed with the Federal Election Commission (FEC) or a reputable news source (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) reporting the total amount raised. The campaign must be actively fundraising and not in a state of suspension or closure. Contributions must be legal and from identifiable sources, excluding any funds raised through illegal means or from anonymous donations.

metadata.source_question: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Q_given_P.title: If Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will his approval ratings exceed 50% among Republican voters by mid-2024?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will Tucker Carlson's approval ratings exceed 50% among Republican voters by June 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: This resolves as Yes if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as No. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as Yes if, by June 30, 2024, a reputable polling organization (e.g., Gallup, Pew Research, Ipsos, etc.) reports that Tucker Carlson's approval ratings among registered Republican voters exceed 50%. The polling data must be based on a sample size of at least 1,000 respondents and conducted within the month preceding the resolution date. The approval rating must be explicitly stated as a percentage in the poll results. In the event of conflicting polls, the resolution will be based on the poll conducted closest to the resolution date that meets these criteria. Polls that do not specify the approval rating among Republican voters will not be considered.

P_and_Q.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and have approval ratings exceed 50% among Republican voters by mid-2024?
P_and_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) By June 30, 2024, a reputable polling organization (e.g., Gallup, Pew Research, Ipsos, etc.) reports that Tucker Carlson's approval ratings among registered Republican voters exceed 50%. The polling data must be based on a sample size of at least 1,000 respondents and conducted within the month preceding the resolution date. The approval rating must be explicitly stated as a percentage in the poll results. In the event of conflicting polls, the resolution will be based on the poll conducted closest to the resolution date that meets these criteria. Polls that do not specify the approval rating among Republican voters will not be considered.

Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by June 30, 2024, a reputable polling organization (e.g., Gallup, Pew Research, Ipsos, etc.) reports that Tucker Carlson's approval ratings among registered Republican voters exceed 50%. The polling data must be based on a sample size of at least 1,000 respondents and conducted within the month preceding the resolution date. The approval rating must be explicitly stated as a percentage in the poll results. In the event of conflicting polls, the resolution will be based on the poll conducted closest to the resolution date that meets these criteria. Polls that do not specify the approval rating among Republican voters will not be considered.

Q_given_P.title: Given a Trump family member is the Republican nominee in 2024, will a Trump hold significant political office by 2025?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: A member of the Trump family, defined as Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump, is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. Then, is it true that by December 31, 2025, any member of the Trump family holds a significant political office in the United States?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if one of the aforementioned individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if, by December 31, 2025, any member of the Trump family is elected or appointed to a significant political office in the United States. A 'significant political office' includes positions such as President, Vice President, Senator, Representative, Governor, or any appointed position with substantial influence or authority at the federal or state level. The resolution is based on official election results, government announcements, or credible reports from at least two major news organizations. Temporary or ceremonial positions do not count.

P_and_Q.title: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 and hold a significant political office by 2025?
P_and_Q.body: This question resolves as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) One of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump. (2) By December 31, 2025, any member of the Trump family (defined as Donald Trump, Melania Trump, Ivanka Trump, Eric Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Tiffany Trump, and Barron Trump) is elected or appointed to a significant political office in the United States. A 'significant political office' includes positions such as President, Vice President, Senator, Representative, Governor, or any appointed position with substantial influence or authority at the federal or state level. The resolution will be based on official election results, government announcements, or credible reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). Temporary or ceremonial positions do not count towards this question's resolution.

P.title: Will Donald Trump win the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is the Republican nominee?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if Donald Trump wins the 2024 US Presidential Election, which is defined as receiving the majority of Electoral College votes (at least 270) on November 5, 2024. The outcome must be confirmed by official results from the Federal Election Commission or equivalent authoritative source. If Trump is the Republican nominee but does not run in the election, or if he is disqualified or unable to participate for any reason, the question will resolve as No. Any allegations of fraud or irregularities that do not alter the outcome as determined by official sources will not affect the resolution.

metadata.source_question: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on Donald Trump being the Republican nominee, will he win the 2024 US Presidential Election?
Q_given_P.body:
This question combines the conditions and outcomes of two related questions:

Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means that he is the official candidate representing the Republican Party, as determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Given this condition, will Donald Trump win the 2024 US Presidential Election? This will resolve as Yes if Donald Trump receives the majority of Electoral College votes (at least 270) on November 5, 2024, as confirmed by official results from the Federal Election Commission or equivalent authoritative source. If he does not win the majority of Electoral College votes, the question will resolve as No. Any allegations of fraud or irregularities that do not alter the outcome as determined by official sources will not affect the resolution.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Donald Trump will win the 2024 US Presidential Election?
P_and_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) Donald Trump wins the 2024 US Presidential Election, which is defined as receiving the majority of Electoral College votes (at least 270) on November 5, 2024. The outcome must be confirmed by official results from the Federal Election Commission or equivalent authoritative source. If Trump is the Republican nominee but does not run in the election, or if he is disqualified or unable to participate for any reason, or if he does not win the majority of Electoral College votes, the question will resolve as No. Any allegations of fraud or irregularities that do not alter the outcome as determined by official sources will not affect the resolution.

P.title: Will Donald Trump win the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is the Republican nominee?

The outcome must be confirmed by official results from the Federal Election Commission or equivalent authoritative source. If Trump is the Republican nominee but does not run in the election, or if he is disqualified or unable to participate for any reason, the question will resolve as No. Any allegations of fraud or irregularities that do not alter the outcome as determined by official sources will not affect the resolution.

Q.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
Q.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on Tucker Carlson being the Republican nominee, will his campaign raise over $10 million by the end of 2023?
Q_given_P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2023, Tucker Carlson's campaign has officially reported raising over $10 million in total contributions, provided he is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The total must be confirmed through a public disclosure report filed with the Federal Election Commission (FEC) or a reputable news source (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) reporting the total amount raised. The campaign must be actively fundraising and not in a state of suspension or closure. Contributions must be legal and from identifiable sources, excluding any funds raised through illegal means or from anonymous donations.

Criterion for condition: Tucker Carlson must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will mean the condition is not met.

P_and_Q.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and will his campaign raise over $10 million by the end of 2023?
P_and_Q.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election; and (2) by December 31, 2023, Tucker Carlson's campaign has officially reported raising over $10 million in total contributions. 

For the first condition, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

For the second condition, the total amount raised must be confirmed through a public disclosure report filed with the Federal Election Commission (FEC) or a reputable news source (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) reporting the total amount raised. The campaign must be actively fundraising and not in a state of suspension or closure. Contributions must be legal and from identifiable sources, excluding any funds raised through illegal means or from anonymous donations.

Q_given_P.title: Given Donald Trump is the Republican nominee, will he face legal challenges affecting his 2024 candidacy?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will he face legal challenges that affect his candidacy for the 2024 election?

This question will resolve as Yes if, by November 5, 2024, Donald Trump faces legal challenges that result in any of the following outcomes that affect his ability to run for President in the 2024 election:
1. A felony conviction that disqualifies him from running for office under the 14th Amendment, Section 3.
2. A court ruling that prohibits him from appearing on the ballot in any state.
3. A significant legal action (such as an indictment) that leads to a substantial media narrative or public perception that he is unable to effectively campaign or serve if elected.

Legal challenges must be confirmed by credible reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If he is found not guilty or the charges are dropped after the resolution date, it will not affect the outcome of this question.

P_and_Q.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and face legal challenges that affect his candidacy?
P_and_Q.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, and not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) By November 5, 2024, Donald Trump faces legal challenges that result in any of the following outcomes affecting his ability to run for President in the 2024 election:
   1. A felony conviction that disqualifies him from running for office under the 14th Amendment, Section 3.
   2. A court ruling that prohibits him from appearing on the ballot in any state.
   3. A significant legal action (such as an indictment) that leads to a substantial media narrative or public perception that he is unable to effectively campaign or serve if elected.

Legal challenges must be confirmed by credible reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If he is found not guilty or the charges are dropped after the resolution date, it will not affect the outcome of this question.

Q_given_P.title: Given Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will voter turnout among Republicans be higher than in 2020?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is the nominee. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is the following true: Voter turnout among Republicans in 2024 is higher compared to the 2020 election? This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, official voter turnout statistics from the U.S. Election Assistance Commission or a similar authoritative body show that the percentage of registered Republican voters who cast ballots in the 2024 presidential election is higher than the percentage of registered Republican voters who voted in the 2020 presidential election. Voter turnout must be measured as a percentage of registered voters, and the comparison must be based on the same data collection methods used in 2020. Any discrepancies in data collection or reporting methods between the two elections must be taken into account. If the data from authoritative sources is inconclusive or disputed, the question will resolve as No.

P_and_Q.body:

All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, official voter turnout statistics from the U.S. Election Assistance Commission or a similar authoritative body show that the percentage of registered Republican voters who cast ballots in the 2024 presidential election is higher than the percentage of registered Republican voters who voted in the 2020 presidential election. If the data from authoritative sources is inconclusive or disputed, the question will resolve as No.

P.title: Will the Republican Party's support for Donald Trump increase or decrease leading up to the 2024 election?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by November 5, 2024, polls and surveys conducted by reputable organizations (e.g., Gallup, Pew Research, Ipsos) indicate that at least 60% of registered Republican voters express support for Donald Trump as their preferred candidate for the Republican nomination for the 2024 presidential election. Support must be measured in a standardized manner, and the question will resolve as No if the percentage falls below 60%. The resolution will also consider endorsements from major Republican figures or organizations that indicate a significant increase in support for Trump. In case of conflicting data, the average of the last three reputable polls conducted before the election will be used to determine the outcome.

This support must be measured in a standardized manner, and endorsements from major Republican figures or organizations indicating a significant increase in support for Trump will also be considered. (2) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
